sense.name: the upkeep of equipment or machinery
sense.examples: The computer system will be down this weekend for maintenance. Dallas is a hub where that airline does a lot of its aircraft maintenance. Expenses of running a hotel include utilities and maintenance.

sense.name: providing living expenses, sustenance
sense.commentary: MAINTENANCE[+activity][+intentional][+provision][+living_expenses] Note: a narrow usage of Sense 3, always implies living expenses, needs
sense.examples: John took the job to provide better maintenance of his growing family. The village's maintenance is largely dependent on fishing.

sense.name: the ongoing preservation or continuation of something
sense.examples: Certain social conditions are required for the maintenance of democratic government. The military ships are stationed there to insure a steady maintenance of oil to the region.

sense.name: alimony, financial support in a divorce
sense.examples: The judge increased Bob's monthly maintenance to his ex-wife by 10 percent. Their prenuptial agreement specified that no maintenance would be required in the event of divorce.

sense.name: unauthorized meddling in a legal proceeding
sense.examples: He was charged with criminal maintenance in the case.
